questiontext.text: Which statement is true when a checkin operation is performed by the Content Server

answer.text: The Lock Owner property must match the user name performing the operation before the Lock Owner property is cleared out.
The Lock Owner property is set with the user name performing the operation.
The Owner property is set with the user name performing the operation.
The Last Access Date property is set to the current date and time.

questiontext.text: What is required to enable editing of a document in the repository

answer.text: The document must be checked out.
The document must use an appropriate permission set with Edit Write permission.
The document must be owned by the user performing the edit.
The user must not be editing other documents.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding a document object with renditions

answer.text: Renditions are generated for each version of a document.
Renditions are generated for only new versions of a document.
Renditions are generated only from the original content.

questiontext.text: What implements subscriptions to document objects
What must the client application do to enable a user to view a different rendition format than theoriginal associated with the document object

answer.text: Request the format from the same document object.
Request the format from a different object related to the original.
Generate the rendition being requested by the user.
Request the format from the previous version of the document object.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true about fulltext activation in D2

answer.text: For optimal fulltext search capabilities, DQL Fulltext and Documentum xPlore should be used simultaneously.
Activation of fulltext search capabilities using Documentum xPlore and OpenSearch requires an external search engine installation.
Activation of fulltext search capabilities using DQL Fulltext and OpenSearch requires an external search engine installation.
For optimal fulltext search capabilities, DQL Fulltext and OpenSearch should be used simultaneously.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding functionality in D2 version 4.0 and later

answer.text: Google syntax is no longer supported for simple and advanced searches.
Boolean syntax is only supported in advanced searches.
The default setting for simple search is 5 results.

questiontext.text: What is the process used to ensure that multiple repositories can share the same subset ofdocuments
What facilitates access to a specific document from different locations
Which product provides policybased implementation of Information Lifecycle Management
Which benefit does the Branch Office Caching Services BOCS architecture provide in a singlerepository distributed environment

answer.text: A copy of the content to store at each location is created.
Content upload and download performance is improved.
Content and properties from the repository are published to a target site.
Global users, global groups, and global ACLs can be created on a governing repository to be replicated onto member repositories.

questiontext.text: When using a Documentum web application, which components are required for accessing arepository
Which architectural characteristic of Documentum provides for aggregation of unstructuredcontent
Which formats can be stored in the Documentum repository

answer.text: Any format that is stored on a computer

questiontext.text: An administrator has modified an XML document in the file system.How can the administrator replace an XML document that already exists in the repository with themodified document

answer.text: Delete the existing document from the repository and import the replacement file.
Checkout the existing document and check in the replacement document from file.
Checkout the document from the file system and check it back in as a new major version.
Import the new document to the repository.

questiontext.text: What is a characteristic feature of My Documentum for Desktop

answer.text: Integration with Windows File System Explorer

questiontext.text: Which Webtop feature enables quick access to favorite documents from the browser tree menu
What happens to a Microsoft Word document when a user imports it into the repository

answer.text: A copy of the document is made and imported into the repository file store.
Nothing. Documentum only stores metadata along with a pointer to the document in the file system.
A copy of the document is made and imported along with metadata into the repository.
The original document is moved from the file system and imported into the repository file store.

questiontext.text: In a Documentum environment, how is it apparent to a user that Microsoft Office integrations areenabled on their machine

answer.text: The user is restricted to using only Microsoft Office formats when creating new documents.
A Microsoft logo appears in the upperright corner of the Webtop home page.
A Documentum menu option displays when the user opens Microsoft Word.
A Microsoft Office menu option displays when the user logs in to Webtop.

questiontext.text: A Webtop user checks out a Microsoft Word document from the repository and edits it.How will the user be prompted upon checkin of the edited document

answer.text: Checkin as the same, next minor, or next major version.
Checkin as either the next major or minor version

questiontext.text: When a document object is checked in as the same version, which statement is true

answer.text: All renditions are orphaned from all versions.
All renditions are orphaned from the current version.
No renditions are orphaned from the current version.
All renditions remain attached to a document object regardless of same version checkin.

questiontext.text: If a user has completed the checkout operation on a document object, which statement is true

answer.text: Only this user or a superuser can cancel the checkout operation.
Only this user can cancel the checkout operation.
Only this user or a superuser cancheckin the document object.
Only the superuser can cancel the checkout operation.

questiontext.text: When a document with renditions is versioned, which statement is true

answer.text: New renditions must be generated automatically.
All renditions from previous version are carried over by default.
All renditions remain attached to a document object regardless of new version checkin.
All renditions are orphaned from all versions.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true for checking in multiple document objects to a repository

answer.text: The client application determines if two or more document objects can be allowed to have the same name in the same folder.
The Content Server determines if two or more document objects can be allowed to have the same name in the same folder.
The data dictionary can be configured to allow more than one document object with the same name in the same folder.
The Content Server architecture does not allow document objects with the same name in the same folder.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true for a user who has Browse and Extended Delete and does not belong toany roles listed on the permission set

answer.text: The user can view the document objects content and delete the document object.
The user can move or delete the document object but is unable to view the properties.
The user can move or delete the document object and view its content.
The user can view the properties but is unable to view the document objects content.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding versioning when a user edits version 1.1 of a document object,which is an older version than what is currently available

answer.text: A new version of the document object is created, and 1.0 is appended to the edited version.
A new version of the document object is created, and 2.0 is appended to the edited version.
The document object is saved as version 1.1.
The document object is saved as version 2.0.

questiontext.text: A client application applies the In Review version label to a document object.What is the expected behavior the next time a user performs a checkin on that document

answer.text: The In Review version label can be applied to the new version of the document and the previous version.
The In Review version label can be applied to the new version of the document and is removed from the previous version.
The In Review version label cannot be applied to the new version of the document and remains with the previous version.
The In Review version label can be applied to the new version of the document, while the previous version with the same label will be deleted by the Content Server.

questiontext.text: A user has Edit Write permission on a document object that is contained in FolderA. The sameuser has Edit Write permission on FolderA and FolderB.The user wants to move the document object from FolderA to FolderB.Which statement is true

answer.text: The user can move the document from FolderA to FolderB without acquiring additional permissions.
The user must also have Delete permission on the document object and FolderA to move the document.
The user must have Delete permission on the document object and both folders to move the document.
The user must have Delete permission on both folders to move the document.

questiontext.text: When renditions are managed along with the document objects primary rendition, whichstatement is true

answer.text: Renditions can be of any format but multiple renditions with the same format cannot exist.
Renditions can be of any format but multiple renditions with the same format cannot exist within the same version.
Renditions can be of any format.
Renditions can be of any format that is not the same format as the primary rendition.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true about the ability to drag and drop objects from within Webtop to the userslocal desktop

answer.text: The feature works when multiple files are selected.
The feature works only when the browsers security level is set to Medium.
The feature is enabled for all users by default.
The feature is only available through the clipboard.

questiontext.text: What can be subscribed to in the repository
Where in Webtop can the default application for viewing objects be set
What does the CopyPaste function in Webtop accomplish

answer.text: creates a link to the object in the repository
creates a new, unrelated object in the repository
copies content to be pasted into other documents
moves the object to another repository location

questiontext.text: Which action does the Content Server perform when a user rightclicks an object and selects Edit

answer.text: It adds a new version to the object.
It adds a new rendition to the object.
It changes the object location within the repository.

questiontext.text: What is required for a user to initiate editing of a document in D2 that is stored in the repository

answer.text: The document must be the current version.
The document must not have any renditions.
The document must not be checked out.
The document cannot be part of a virtual document.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding renditions

answer.text: Renditions can be added automatically using Media Transformation Services MTS.
Each version of a document can have only one rendition in each file format.
Renditions are copied to the new version when versioning a document.
Renditions of a document may be edited by any user with SYSADMIN privilege in the repository and WRITE permission on the document.

questiontext.text: How are the attributes that are used in the Webtop Smart Navigation feature configured

answer.text: By each user, on the Advanced Search page.
On the repository, by the administrator, and cannot be changed by the user.
The attributes used are automatically computed and cannot be changed by the user.
By each user, in User Preferences.

questiontext.text: What is the foundation on which each search template in TaskSpace is built

answer.text: a folder or set of folders

questiontext.text: By default, which search configuration does Webtop Advanced Search allow
What is the Place in Text filter available for when using CenterStage
In CenterStage, which action is necessary to enable users to search for content in remoterepositories

answer.text: Configure My Preferences to include the remote repository folders.
Connect the CenterStage server to the remote repositorys index servers.

questiontext.text: A CenterStage user performs a global search and receives the error message AuthenticationfailedHow can the user fix the error and successfully perform this search

answer.text: Provide valid credentials for the search source that failed in My Preferences.
Log in to the operating system as a different user.
Log in to CenterStage with different credentials.
Configure the search filter to be performed on the server that failed.

questiontext.text: What is necessary to limit a search to a single CenterStage space

answer.text: The search expression must be entered in the CenterStage toolbar Search field and Search in my extra sources must be unchecked.
The search expression must be entered into the Search field in the CenterStage toolbar using xPlore syntax to specify the space.
The space must be open. The search expression must be entered in the CenterStage toolbar Search field and Search in my extra sources must be unchecked.
The space must be open. The search expression must be entered in the spaces Search tab, in

questiontext.text: How do search rankings in CenterStage appear

answer.text: As a number from one to five

questiontext.text: Which object properties are indexed by xPlore

answer.text: properties of dmsysobject and subtypes of dmsysobject
properties of dmfilestore and subtypes of dmfilestore

questiontext.text: If lemmatization is enabled for repository searches, what will users notice when they performsearches using Webtop

answer.text: Search results include variations of search terms, increasing the number of results.
The Preferences include settings that allow users to specify how lemmatization is applied to their searches.
The Advanced Search page includes an extra checkbox, allowing the user to enable

questiontext.text: Using D2, which feature is configurable for simple searches
What can provide quick access to objects that are frequently used
Which attribute is among those that Webtop simple search runs against when fulltext indexing isNOT enabled
Assuming that xPlore is installed and the repository is configured to use it, when is an objectsmetadata searchable

answer.text: when the metadata is stored in the database
after keywords are applied to the object
after the object is checked in

questiontext.text: How does indexing latency in xPlore affect repository searches

answer.text: The Content Server must be restarted to detect indexing modifications.
Searching for objects based on object property values that were changed or removed is not possible until the Index Server reindexes the object.
Searching can be performed immediately on an indexed object using changed or updated information.
Searching changed metadata is available for modified documents but changed content is only searchable after the content is reindexed.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding Webtop Advanced Search

answer.text: Multiple search locations may be selected in single repositories.
Only objects of type dmsysobject or subtypes of dmsysobject can be searched.
In the search results, documents owned by the user will be listed first.
It is intended for users with SYSADMIN privilege or members of the admin group.

questiontext.text: A user with NONE privilege created a public Saved Search in Webtop.Which statement is true

answer.text: The Saved Search is available only to the user who created it.
For other users to run the Saved Search, permission on the Saved Search dmsmartlist object must be modified.
The Saved Search is available to all users without any other configuration needed.
For other users to run the Saved Search, the Saved Search dmsmartlist object must be moved to the sysadminsaved search folder.

questiontext.text: In Webtop, by default, what is the maximum number of results that are returned for a search

answer.text: 1,000 results, with up to 350 results from a single source
500 results, with up to 200 results from a single source
750 results, with up to 250 results from a single source
2,000 results with up to 500 results from single source

questiontext.text: When using the Webtop Advanced Search page to find all objects created and updated within theprevious week, on which attribute should a user search
A user is performing a search in Webtop and needs to display a Title column in the search resultlist.Where should the user add the Title column

answer.text: In the Webtop main frame, directly on the column headers

questiontext.text: Using Webtops Simple Search, a user enters Specification as the search parameter.Assuming fulltext searching is NOT enabled for the repository, what will be included in the searchresults

answer.text: all versions of all objects that contain Specification in their objectname or in their title
the current versions of all objects that whose objectname, subject, or title includes Specification
all versions of objects and their renditions that include Specification in their objectname
the current versions of objects and renditions that contain Specification in their objectname

questiontext.text: xPlore is not installed and configured for the repository. A user executes a Simple Search inWebtop for quick brown fox.Which types of objects will be included in the search results

answer.text: only objects with the word quick and the word brown and the word fox in the objectname, title OR subject property
only objects that have quick brown fox in the objectname, title, AND subject properties
only objects that have quick brown fox in the objectname, title OR subject property
only objects with the word quick, the word brown, and the word fox in the objectname, title AND subject property

questiontext.text: UserA searches for objects within a folder, and 85 objects are returned. UserB performs the samesearch and 0 objects are returned.Which statement is true regarding UserBs permissions on the objects and the folder

answer.text: UserB has only None permission to the objects and the folder.
UserB has only None permission to the folder where the objects are located.
UserB has only None permission to the objects in the folder.
UserB has only None permission to the cabinet that contains the folder.

questiontext.text: How can a user add a descendant to a virtual document in Webtop

answer.text: 1. Add the descendent from the system Clipboard. 2. Create a new document to be used as the descendant. 3. Draganddrop the descendent to the virtual document. 4. Select a file from the users system to be used as the descendent.

1. Create a new window and reposition the descendent. 2. Modify the version label of the virtual document. 3. Remove an existing descendent and import an earlier version. 4. Specify the documents URL.
1. Create a new document to be used as the descendant. 2. Create a new window and reposition the descendent. 3. Draganddrop the descendent to the virtual document. 4. Specify the documents URL.

1. Add the descendent from the system Clipboard. 2. Draganddrop the descendent to the virtual document. 3. Modify the version label of the virtual document. 4. Select a file from the users system to be used as the descendent.

questiontext.text: Which statement about virtual documents in a Documentum repository is true

answer.text: Virtual documents restrict the addition and modification of content within in a single, larger document structure to a single contributor.
Virtual documents are maintained by the Content Server separate from one another.
Virtual documents normalize the formats of each document within in a large document structure.
Virtual documents provide the ability to unite documents with varying formats into one document.

questiontext.text: A virtual document in Webtop contains no content.By default, what happens when a user clicks the virtual documents name

answer.text: A component for that virtual document is automatically created.
The virtual document is automatically converted into a simple document.
The Virtual Document Manager automatically shows broken bindings.
The Virtual Document Manager automatically displays the virtual documents structure.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true about the relationship between virtual documents and XML documents

answer.text: XML documents and virtual documents both have hierarchical structures.
XML documents automatically parse and organize imported compound virtual documents.
A single query is used to find all direct descendents of XML documents or virtual documents.
A single query is used to list all XML documents and all virtual documents.

questiontext.text: Which statement about virtual document components is true

answer.text: The Content Server creates a dmrcontainment object that combines all components of a virtual document.
A document can be a component of multiple virtual documents.
Adding a component to a virtual document changes that component.
When a component document is updated, every virtual document it is in must be updated separately.

questiontext.text: Which statement describes an assembly

answer.text: A snapshot that reflects the state of all components of a virtual document at a specific point in time
The standardization of the formats of each component within of a virtual document
The dmrcontainment object that the Content Server creates for a virtual documents components
The repositioning of a descendent in a virtual document

questiontext.text: Several reviewers annotated the Employee Handbook document. Another reviewer is attemptingto access those annotations but is unable to do so.Why is the reviewer unable to access the annotations

answer.text: The reviewer has not assigned the permissions that are required for accessing the annotations.
The annotations are not related to each other.
The Employee Handbook document is not linked to the annotations.
The annotations do not have a relationship to the Employee Handbook document.

questiontext.text: Which statement best describes a Documentum Relationship

answer.text: The connection between two items in a repository
An association among several objects in a virtual document
The connection between the links of the same object
An association of the same content file to different object versions

questiontext.text: By default, how does the Content Server authenticate user accounts
What can a Superuser do that a user with Sysadmin privilege cannot
Which privilege does a user need to view all the documents in the repository using Webtop
When creating a new user, which attributes are required
What is the purpose of a users extended privileges

answer.text: To grant a user all of the privileges needed by a system administrator
To allow a user to create and delete systemlevel permission sets
To control the ability of a user to work with audit functionality
To control the ability of a user to modify permissions on all objects in a repository

questiontext.text: What does the Sysadmin privilege enable a user to do

answer.text: Change the owner of a document.
Modify or drop another users custom types.

questiontext.text: Which function can a user with System Administrator privilege perform

answer.text: unlock objects in the repository, regardless of ownership
manipulate workflows or workflow items, regardless of ownership
view audit trail entries, regardless of who registered the audited event
select from any underlying RDBMS table, whether it is registered or not

questiontext.text: What does a users inline password authentication setting do

answer.text: Authenticates the users password with a password stored in the dmuser object for that user
Authenticates the users password with one of a series of LDAP servers
Authenticates the users password with either a password stored in the dmuser object for that user or in the users default group
Authenticates the users password with the operating system on the content server

questiontext.text: What does the Extended Delete permission on a document enable a user to do

answer.text: Delete a document that is marked as immutable.
Delete a documents content without deleting the dmdocument object.
Delete a document even if the user has less than DELETE basic permission.
Delete only older versions of documents, but not the current version.

questiontext.text: Which action is possible when LDAP is used with Documentum
What are valid values for the Client Capability setting of a user
What can be imported using the Sync and Authentication tab of the LDAP Server Configurationobject
An administrator created a group in Webtop called Dept As Group.How will the name property of Dept As Group appear in the repository
Which statement about the groupname attribute of the group object is true

answer.text: It has a maximum length of 32 characters.
It has a maximum length of 26 characters.
It has a minimum length of 6 characters.
It has a minimum length of 8 characters.

questiontext.text: What is a role an instance of
Which task must an administrator do to enable Domain Group functionality

answer.text: Add member roles to the Domain Group.
Add a superuser to every role.
Add a superuser to every group.
Remove member roles from the Domain Group.

questiontext.text: A Webtop user has the Client Capability attribute set to Consumer.Which restrictions are imposed on this user

answer.text: Cannot delete documents or view documents.
Cannot delete workflows or view forms.
Cannot delete documents or launch workflows.
Cannot delete groups or launch workflows.

questiontext.text: An administrator writes custom code to enable the addition or removal of users to DynamicGroups.Where should this custom code be placed

answer.text: in a custom user object type
in a custom group object type

questiontext.text: What is a direct subtype of dmsysobject
Which combination of items can be included in a Dynamic Group
What must be in place in the client to enable the addition of users to a Dynamic Group
User A needs to add a rendition to a document. User B then needs to annotate the rendition thatUser A added.Which Documentum basic permissions are required for these users

answer.text: User A Write User B Relate
User A Write User B Version
User A Version User B Relate
User A Delete User B Version

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding default values for basic and extended permissions in aDocumentum permission set for dmowner

answer.text: They are configured in the Content Server configuration object.
They are configured in the Server.ini file.
They are configured in the Repository configuration object.

questiontext.text: By default, which choices are available for the acl configuration
Corporate policy prohibits employees from editing documents, and stipulates that employees canonly make on documents.Which minimum permission must be assigned to the documents to enforce this policy

Corporate policy mandates that a new minor or major version of a document must be createdevery time a document is edited.Which minimum permission must be applied to the documents to enforce this policy
Which statement is true regarding the deletion of a document from the Documentum repository

answer.text: If the user has Write permission they will be able to delete the properties and leave the content in the repository.
If the user has Delete permission they will be able to edit or view the document.
If the user has Write permission they will be able to delete the content and leave the properties in the repository.
If the user has Delete permission they will be able to delete the content and leave the properties in the repository.

questiontext.text: A user creates a permission set and is the owner of that permission set.Which type of permission set does the user have
Which statement is true regarding permission set templates and a normal permission set

answer.text: A permission set template cannot be deleted while a normal permission set can.
A normal permission set can be created by any user, however a permission set template can only be created by members of the formuser role.
A normal permission set cannot contain any aliases while a permission set template can contain aliases.
A permission set template can be created with Documentum Administrator.

questiontext.text: Which action requires WRITE permission, at a minimum

answer.text: Check in a document as the same version.
Check in a document as the next minor version.
Check in a document as the next major version.
Check in and view the content of a Microsoft Word document.

questiontext.text: What is the purpose of folder security in a Documentum repository

answer.text: To allow unauthorized users to export a folder and its content
To allow unauthorized users to change a folders content
To prevent unauthorized users from changing a folders content
To prevent unauthorized users from exporting a folder and its content

questiontext.text: What determines the name of a custom permission set

answer.text: The Content Server and user input

questiontext.text: Due to a high volume of tasks and the need for quick processing, a more efficient workflow isneeded.Which Documentum Tool and Configuration Object should be used in the configuration of thebusiness process
In a workflow template, what is transferred by ports among the workflows activities

An administrator requires the ability to create an activity by copying an existing activity. Theadministrator also needs to configure different protocols.Which component fulfills these functionality requirements
Which statement is true about D2 workflows

answer.text: D2 workflows are implemented as a combination of Documentum workflow templates and D2 workflow configurations.
D2 workflow templates reference an existing Documentum workflow configuration and define the details of how the workflow behaves in D2.
While a D2 workflow is running, task recipients can view the workflow diagram in the D2 client application if the workflow template is created in Composer.
D2 workflow configuration objects consist of display strings, workflow behavior, and performers.

questiontext.text: What enables users to easily develop process and eventoriented applications for documentmanagement
What executes the automatic activities of a business process
When a workflow supervisor first creates and saves a workflow object, in which state is thatworkflow
Which statement is correct regarding workflow attachments

answer.text: Workflow attachments have to match the package type.
Workflow attachments can only be applied by the workflow supervisor.

questiontext.text: What are the tasks that comprise the business process in a business process template
Aliases in a workflow can be used for which components
What does the work queue policy in a business process determine

answer.text: The identity of the workflow supervisor for the queue
Whether a task will be processed by the queue
The order of the tasks for the queue

questiontext.text: What can be created to formalize a repeatable process that has been ad hoc in the past
A parent workflow initiates a child workflow, and the parent workflow is configured to wait for thechild workflow to complete. What must happen for the parent workflow to proceed

answer.text: A notification must be received in the parents activity after the child workflow completes.
The Content Server must receive an event after the child workflow completes.
The Documentum Messaging Services must receive an event after the child workflow completes.
An event must be received in the parents activity after the child workflow completes.

questiontext.text: A running workflow instances automated activity has failed and another automatic activity needsto be triggered.How can the workflow be configured to anticipate failures of the automated activity

answer.text: Configure the automated activity with a fault handling activity.
Configure the automated activity to auto retry.
Configure the automated activity with a reject flow.
Configure the automated activity to continue execution.

questiontext.text: When configuring an Email Inbound Step or Initiate activity in the Process Activity Inspector,what is a valid protocol for connecting to the email server
What can a user with the minimum role of queuemanager do while monitoring the work queues

answer.text: Obtain information about which queues have overdue tasks or have too many tasks
Request work, suspend and unsuspend work, complete work, and reassign work to others
Select tasks to work on from one or more work queue inboxes
Create work queues and queue policies

questiontext.text: How is a skill set for the queue and its processors defined on a queue containing workflow tasks

answer.text: As a Work Assignment Matching Filter

questiontext.text: What is the purpose of queue categories

answer.text: To enable queue administrators to organize work queues in a logical representation
To list the abilities, properties, or expertise necessary to perform tasks in a work queue
To track and manage tasks in the work queue
To allow the priority and aging of a task to be controlled based on the document properties and lifecycle

questiontext.text: The queue policy must exist in order to complete which task in Documentum Administrator

answer.text: Provide detailed information on work assignment matching
Add a user or group to a work queue

questiontext.text: An activity in a workflow is configured by choosing a group and setting Least Amount of UnfinishedWork Items.How is the workflow task assigned

answer.text: The workflow task is assigned to a member who is most available to perform the task.
The workflow task is assigned to a member who acquires the task first.
The workflow task is assigned to a member from a Performer Alias.
The workflow task is assigned to a member from a list of multiple users sequentially.

questiontext.text: A Legal department has just been notified of a newly instated law. There is a legal form that needsto be updated, reviewed, and published within the hour. There is only one publisher that isavailable for these tasks.What is required if quickflow is used to send the publisher the tasks

answer.text: A lifecycle on the legal form
A recipient of the legal form
A subscription of the legal form to publisher

questiontext.text: Which task can a performer complete when a workflow contains a reject flow

answer.text: Return a package to a previous performer.
Command the system to perform the activity on behalf of a user.
Advance a package from an activity to the next activity in the normal workflow.
Allow the activity to be performed by a person or multiple people.

questiontext.text: Why is the install action necessary on a workflow template that was created by a user in ProcessBuilder

answer.text: To allow the customer to find the workflow in the system
To verify that the process defined in the template meets system requirements
To lock and edit an existing process template

questiontext.text: If auditing for the workflow template is turned on, which type of information is available to theadministrator

answer.text: Information about updates to the workflow template
Information about the deletion of the workflow template
Information about installation of the workflow template
Information about the execution of workflow instances started by the workflow template

questiontext.text: The publishing workflow process has been started on a news article. Using Webtop and workflowreporting, which task can be completed

answer.text: Find and halt the publishing workflow.
Access aggregate data from multiple publishing workflows.
Designate a proxy to manage the publishing workflow tasks.

questiontext.text: When is an uninstall of a process template necessary

answer.text: When modifying the process template so that new activity can be added
When checking out a process template
When creating a new version of a process template

questiontext.text: To which type can the account that the Content Server uses to perform lifecycle actions beconfigured
Which two states can a lifecycle have
A standard Documentum lifecycle is implemented as an instance of which object type
Which statement is true regarding lifecycles and workflows

answer.text: A lifecycle defines who does what and in which order. A workflow defines entry criteria.
A lifecycle defines what happens in a particular activity. A workflow defines operations and actions.
With lifecycles, objects are forwarded. With workflows, objects are promoted.
A lifecycle is a linear progression of states. A workflow is a network of activities.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true about lifecycles

answer.text: Documentum lifecycles can be used in D2.
Lifecycles configured in D2Config can be used in other Documentum clients.
D2 lifecycles are stored as dmpolicy objects.
The batch lifecycle feature is universal to Documentum and D2.

questiontext.text: How are lifecycles in D2 stored
What is used to create a standard Documentum lifecycle
On which stage or stages of the lifecycle are entry criteria evaluated
Which statement is true regarding State extensions

answer.text: State extensions provide additional information to applications when an object is in a particular lifecycle state.
State extensions specify rules for how exceptions should be handled so exception states can be minimized.
State extensions are used by the Application Server to determine if an object should be promoted.
State extensions are used by Content Server to determine if an object should be promoted.

questiontext.text: What is used to create and configure State extensions

A user is unable to promote an object to the next state in a lifecycle. The user is not the objectowner or a superuser, but has Change State permission on the object.Which additional permission is required to enable the user to perform the desired task
If a lifecycle state specifies a procedure to run, when is the procedure executed

answer.text: When the object is promoted in its lifecycle state and before the state entry criteria are met
When the object is promoted in its lifecycle to the specific state and after the client application validates the object
When the object is promoted in its lifecycle to the specific state and after the state entry criteria are met
When the object is promoted in its lifecycle to the specific state and before the client application validates the object

questiontext.text: What does a lifecycle do

answer.text: Defines the state of a file at each point in the process
Routes documents for editing and approval tasks
Creates new content in the repository
Organizes versions of the same document

questiontext.text: Which dmsysobject attribute refers to the attached lifecycle
Which lifecycle action can be performed from the Webtop interface
What is an exception state in a lifecycle

answer.text: A state from which documents can always return to the base state
A state defined by the business requirement as a deviation from the normal information lifecycle
A state entered by a document if a security exception occurs

questiontext.text: Which action moves a document to a previous lifecycle state
Which statement is true regarding entry criteria for a particular state

answer.text: To bypass entry criteria, a user must modify the policy using Composer.
To bypass entry criteria, a user must own the lifecycle policy object or be a superuser.
To bypass entry criteria, a user must have Write and Change State permissions.

questiontext.text: What is required to enable monitoring of historical process data
Which factor determines the ability to turn on auditing for the purposes of reporting historicalprocess data
Which component is necessary to enable the collection of historical process reports
What is the essential building block of a process report
How must auditing be configured to facilitate process reporting

answer.text: Auditing must be configured on the process template.
Auditing must be configured using Documentum Administrator.
Auditing must be configured through the initiate process form.
Auditing must be configured on the process instance.

questiontext.text: What is required to make a filtered report on process data available

answer.text: A process template must be configured with user inputs.
The ability to specify search criteria must be limited to the workflow supervisor.
The user must input search criteria while viewing the report.
Predefined user inputs must be configured.

questiontext.text: Which functionality does the SMTP activity template provide to users
Which activity requires the content that is sent to it to be a wellformed XML file that is namespaceselfsufficient
What is included in an inbound message and is used to match that message to the processinstance
What enables the exchange of documents and information with people outside the organization,thus extending the automated business processes to include external participants
Which statement is true about DQL

answer.text: DQL can be used to access registered tables.
DQL queries can only be executed by the Installation Owner.
A DQL query can be used to retrieve the content of a document.
DQL contains extensions to override the ACLs created on documents and other objects.

questiontext.text: Which statement about DQL is true

answer.text: DQL can process and manipulate object content in a Documentum repository.
DQL can retrieve and update objects in a Documentum repository, but cannot create or delete them.
DQL can be used to migrate standard objects to lightweight objects.
DQL can import documents into a Documentum repository from any JSR170compliant content management system.

questiontext.text: Which DQL statement is used to modify an object type
Which DQL statement will modify the character size of attribute approvername

answer.text: UPDATE TYPE SOP MODIFY approvername char32
ALTER TYPE SOP MODIFY approvername char32

questiontext.text: Which DQL element is used to identify the object type and RDBMS tables to retrieve from aDocumentum repository
Which statement about DQL is true

answer.text: DQL is a scripted language used to customize Documentum client user interfaces.
DQL requires a user to have at least Browse permission to view property values for a repository object by DQL.
DQL is a compiled language that executes faster than SQL on Oracle databases.
DQL is a more precise language than SQL and therefore returns a more precise set of results.

questiontext.text: What is returned by the following querySELECT FROM dmdocument WHERE rcreationdateDATE040113

answer.text: Apredefined list of properties from dmdocument objects created before April 1, 2013
Apredefined list of properties from dmdocument objects created after April 1, 2013
Apredefined list of properties from dmdocument objects modified or created before April 1, 2013
The creation date property from dmdocument objects created before April 1, 2013

questiontext.text: Which form of the FROM clause will search only the current version of the SOP type

A repository has objects of dmdocument type in a folder named SOPNet. A user wants to findall dmdocument in this folder AND all containing subfolders checked out by them.How can the user complete the following query to accomplish thisselect from dmdocumentwhere rlockowneruser
Which statement about the DQL WHERE clause is true

answer.text: It specifies which object properties should be retrieved.
It specifies the order in which search results should be returned.
It indicates which Documentum repository should be searched.
It may contain logical operators such as AND, OR, or NOT.

questiontext.text: An external table has been registered using this DQL statementREGISTER TABLE airportstable airportnameSTRING256, airportcode STRING3Which DQL statement will return the airportcode for John F. Kennedy Airport

answer.text: SELECT airportcode FROM airportstable WHERE airportname John F. Kennedy Airport
SELECT airportcodetable FROM airportcode name John F. Kennedy Airport
SELECT airportcode FROM airportcodetable. airportname John F. Kennedy Airport
SELECT airportcode FROM dmairportstable WHERE airportname John F. Kennedy Airport

questiontext.text: What is a key feature of Composer Projects

answer.text: The ability to configure role functionality

questiontext.text: Which statement about Composer Projects is true

answer.text: Composer Projects can be archived into DAR files.
Composer Projects have the same characteristics as Virtual Documents.
Composer Projects can be uninstalled from the repository.

questiontext.text: How should Aspects be named within a Composer project

answer.text: The Aspect type and module should be named differently.
The Aspect type and module should have the same names.
Aspect type and module should have the same name as the project.

questiontext.text: What happens when a Composer Project is installed in a repository

answer.text: The repository config object is updated.

questiontext.text: What CANNOT be included in a Composer Project
What is the purpose of a Composer DAR file
Which change is permitted during modification of a custom attribute in Composer

answer.text: Change the datatype from Numeric to String.
Increase the length of a String datatype.
Decrease the length of a String datatype.

questiontext.text: What must be done before dropping a custom type from the repository

answer.text: Delete all sub types and instances of the custom type, or migrate them to the custom types super type.
Delete all attributes of the custom type.
Delete all sub types of the custom type.
Migrate the types attributes to the super type.

questiontext.text: What do Composers pre and post installation procedures determine

answer.text: How to handle existing objects in the repository

questiontext.text: Which statement about Documentum base types is true

answer.text: Certain dmsysobject types can be sub typed.
All Documentum base types can be sub typed.
Documentum base types can be modified.
Only type dmdocument can be sub typed.

questiontext.text: Where are Composer Projects stored
What is the default resolution scope for a Workflow Alias

answer.text: Workflow Object, Session Object, User Performer, Default Group, Server Configuration
Workflow Object, User Performer, Default Group, Session Object, Server Configuration
Session Object, Workflow Object, User Performer, Server Configuration, Default Group
Server Configuration, Default Group, Session Object, User Performer, Workflow Object

questiontext.text: What does the Content Server do when it cannot resolve a workflow alias

answer.text: Content Server posts a notification in the inbox of the workflows supervisor.
Content Server assigns the work item to the next performer.
Content Server ignores the activity and moves to the next activity.

questiontext.text: What is a benefit to using Permission Set Templates

answer.text: The overall number of required Permission Sets is reduced.

questiontext.text: Which aliases are required to ensure portability of an application that creates a document, links toa folder, assigns a permission set, and saves a document
What is a valid alias
Which is a valid alias reference
What does a Template ACL contain
What is the primary purpose for using aliases and alias sets

answer.text: To enhance the client user interface
To speed up the development process

questiontext.text: What is the only required component of an alias reference
Which character precedes an alias value
What can be referenced as an alias

answer.text: An accessor in a permission set

questiontext.text: A user needs to list the names and version labels of all versions of documents in the repository towhich they have permission to access. The user also wants the information about each versiongrouped together.Which DQL query will yield this result

answer.text: select objectname and rversionlabel from dmdocument all
select robjectid, rversionlabel, robjectid from dmdocument all group by rversionlabel
select rversionlabel, objectname from dmdocument all order by rversionlabel
select robjectid, objectname, rversionlabel from dmdocument all

questiontext.text: A user wants to search for a document whose subject is set to server or Server.Which DQL query will do this

answer.text: select objectname from dmdocument where lowersubject server
select objectname from dmdocument where subject like erver
select objectname from dmdocument where subject like erver
select objectname from dmdocument where lowersubject Server

questiontext.text: Which DQL statement will show the object ID of the previous version of a document nameddocument1

answer.text: Select ichronicleid from dmdocument where objectname document1
Select iantecedentid from dmdocument where objectname document1
Select iprevversionid from dmdocument where objectname document1
Select ilatestid from dmdocument where objectname document1

questiontext.text: Which properties of the dmdocument objects are returned by the following DQL querySelect from dmdocument, the

answer.text: All readwrite singlevalued properties, robjectid, robjecttype, rcreationdate, rmodifydate, and acontenttype
All readwrite single and repeatingvalued properties
All readwrite single and repeatingvalued properties, robjectid, robjecttype, rcreationdate, rmodifydate, and acontenttype

questiontext.text: A user wants a list of documents with keywords that contain the words parent, child or bothparent and child.How should the following query be completed to achieve this result selectobjectname fromdmdocument

answer.text: Where any keywordsparent or any keywordschild
Where any keywordsparent and any keywordschild

questiontext.text: A user wants to write a DQL query that can be run on a daily basis to determine which documentswere modified since the start of the previous day.How should the following query be completed to achieve this result selectobjectname fromdmdocument
A user wants to determine how many folders and cabinets are linked to a document namedtestdoc.Which query will do this

answer.text: select count from dmdocument where objectname testdoc
select countrlinkcnt from dmdocument where objectname testdoc
select countireferencecnt from dmdocument where objectname testdoc
select countifolderid from dmdocument where objectname testdoc

questiontext.text: A user needs to change the subject property of a document named Blueprint to Office Building.Which DQL statement will achieve this result

answer.text: update dmdocument object set subject Office Building where objectname Blueprint
update dmdocument set subject Office Building where objectname Blueprint
modify dmdocument object set subject Office Building where objectname Blueprint
modify dmdocument set subject Office Building where objectname Blueprint

questiontext.text: A folder named inner resides in the cabinet named outer.How should a user complete the following query to list all objects directly inside the innerfolderselectobjectname from dmsysobject
Which query will retrieve the names of all document owners and provide a count of the number ofdocuments each user owns

answer.text: select ownername, count from dmdocument group by ownername
select ownername, count from dmdocument order by ownername
select ownername, count from dmdocument having ownername like
select distinct ownername, count from dmdocument

questiontext.text: A user wants to replace the first author of a document named document1 with userA.Which DQL statement will do this

answer.text: update dmdocument object set authors1 userA where objectname document1
update dmdocument object insert authors0 userA where objectname document1
update dmdocument object set authors0 userA where objectname document1
update dmdocument object insert authors1 userA where objectname document1

questiontext.text: Which three tiers define the D2 architecture
Which statement is true regarding D2 configurations

answer.text: Partial configuration loading is not supported, so exported configurations must be completely imported.
Partial configuration loading is supported, so exported configurations cannot be completely imported.
Configurations cannot be exported or imported between Documentum environments.
Configurations can be exported or imported between Documentum environments.

questiontext.text: Which method cannot extend D2
Through which means does D2 provide the ability to customize client interaction with content in arepository
Which statement is true regarding D2s integration with Content Server

answer.text: D2 can stand alone andor use xCP.
D2 is standalone only no xCP support.

questiontext.text: What is used to transfer files between D2 and the client browser

answer.text: ActiveX and Unified Client Facilities UCF

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding D2 after initial installation

answer.text: D2 must be configured before it can be used.
D2 requires no configuration and is ready to use.
D2 must have addon packs installed before first use.
UCF must be configured before D2 can be used.

questiontext.text: How is the majority of client code in D2 authored

answer.text: Using Java, the code is complied into an unobfuscated JavaScript permutation and delivered to the browser in a single file.
Using JavaScript, the code is compiled into an unobfuscated JavaScript permutation and delivered to the browser in a single file.
Using JavaScript, the code is compiled into an unobfuscated JavaScript permutation and delivered to the browser as multiple files.
Using Java, the code is complied into an obfuscated JavaScript permutation and delivered to the browser in a single file.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding changing views or pages in the D2 interface

answer.text: DOM is manipulated to avoid page changes or client JavaScript reload.
Users must navigate pages to switch views.
Client JavaScript reload is required for users to change pages.
DOM is manipulated to avoid page changes, but client JavaScript reload is required.

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding communication in D2

answer.text: Monitored web traffic has a data payload that is either XML or JSON.
Communication between the browser and client is through Google Web Toolkit GWT RPC calls.
Communication between the browser and client is through binary RPC calls.
Java applets are the primary communication mechanism between D2 and the server.

questiontext.text: Which Documentum configuration tool is used to design user interface pages for an xCP 1.xapplication
Which tool is used to deploy xCP 1.x applications into different environments
What is the role of Documentum Process Integrator in xCP 1.x applications

answer.text: It integrates process, content, and repository services with external systems and applications.
It integrates processrelated events with Business Activity Monitor BAM reporting services.
It enables Forms Builder pages to display process data and attachments.
It exposes full taskprocessing functionality within the TaskSpace interface.

questiontext.text: In an xCP 1.x application, Business Activity Monitor BAM cannot provide reporting data for aparticular process unless which feature is enabled in the process template
End users interact with xCP 1.x applications using which webbased client
Which tool is used to configure document routing as well as review and approval functionality foran xCP 1.x application
What is the role of Document Image Services in xCP 1.x applications

answer.text: To allow media content to be attached to workflows
To efficiently process and store image data

questiontext.text: Which Documentum configuration tool is used to design user interface pages for an xCP 2.xapplication
When developing an xCP 2.x application, the application can be quickly deployed for testingpurposes using which tool
End users interact with xCP 2.x applications using which webbased client

answer.text: HTML pages configured in xCP Designer

questiontext.text: In xCP 2.x, which type of reports can the BAM component generate

answer.text: reports about business events and processes
reports about application errors and processes
reports about user exceptions and processes

questiontext.text: Which statement regarding xMS and xCP 2.x applications is true

answer.text: xMS easily integrates xCP solutions with inplace thirdparty systems.
xMS quickly deploys xCP solutions in a VMware cloud environment.
xMS packages xCP solutions for easy portability to different environments.
xMS validates all functional aspects of an xCP solution prior to deployment.

questiontext.text: How are business rules implemented in xCP 2.x

answer.text: using functional expressions that drive processflow through user actions and activity triggering
using custom code attached to business objects
using custom process parameters that can be changed by an administrator at runtime
using design widgets organized on an HTML form

questiontext.text: Which statement about the xCP 2.x viewer framework is true

answer.text: The xCP 2.x viewer framework enables users to view and manage their preference settings in an xCP application.
The xCP 2.x viewer framework integrates with xMS to display installation blueprints for deployment.
The xCP 2.x viewer framework allows thirdparty viewers to be used in an xCP solution.
The xCP 2.x viewer framework provides an integrated development platform for building xCP solutions.

questiontext.text: Which xCP 2.x component provides discovered metadata for content objects
What are the guiding principles of EMC Energy and Engineering Solutions

answer.text: Environmental, Health and Safety EHS Compliance industry standards interoperability
Environmental, Health and Safety EHS Compliance business readiness optimization

questiontext.text: What are used to determine the users to whom the Energy and Engineering Solutions transmittalsare sent
Which Energy and Engineering Solutions architecture layer contains services such as transmittals,bulk loading, progress tracking, and project configuration
Which tool provides Energy and Engineering Solutions with the ability to rapidly load and indexdocument batches
Documentum Life Sciences products are built on which client technology
Which user interfaces are supported by the Life Sciences Solution Suite
Which statement regarding functionality of the Life Sciences Solution Suite is true

answer.text: It reduces Environmental Health and Safety noncompliance risk with internal and crosscompany collaboration.
It provides the ability to quickly generate highly customized communications using Microsoft and Adobe tools.
It provides a complete Web Services toolkit for adding interactive document services to existing applications used to manage customer interactions.
It provides product, study, trial, and project library management for business owners to reduce IT dependencies.

questiontext.text: Which statement regarding functionality of the Life Sciences Solution Suite is true

answer.text: It enables organizations to easily and effectively control their GMP Good Manufacturing Practices content, prevent revenue loss due to work interruptions, and eliminate compliance related fines.
It provides a new business paradigm for ediscovery services at a low cost per gigabyte ratio.
It transforms paper documents, faxes, and electronic information into actionable data used by enterprise applications and processes.
It allows organizations to leverage enterprise content stored in Documentum and generate multichannel communications ondemand, interactively, via workflow, and in batch.

questiontext.text: A government customer has a requirement to enforce compliance and governance to UnitedStates Department of Defense standards.Which product should be the basis of their solution
Which product retrieves workflow process execution data from the Content Server audit trail,consolidates it in its own database, and generates graphical dashboard reports accessible throughTaskSpace

A customer wants to provide its graphic artists with a Documentum WDKbased client thatdisplays files as image thumbnails. The customer wants the client user interface to have a similarlook and feel to Webtop.Which client product satisfies this requirement
A customer has a large volume of check images that they want to store in the Documentumrepository.Which product is most appropriate given this requirement
Which High Volume Server feature enables the creation of an offline partition in the database,loads data into that offline partition, and then rapidly brings that offline partition online
Which product enables customers to enforce security policies on documents even when they areemailed to other parties that are outside of the organization
Which product can be used to develop applications in a Service Oriented Architecture
A customer has a requirement to maintain controlled documents pursuant to United States federalregulatory requirements.Which product can satisfy this requirement

A customer has a requirement to enable employees to have fast access to documents from any ofthe companys worldwide distributed offices. The office staff has no knowledge of Documentumsystem administration.Which distributed content solution satisfies this customers requirements

answer.text: Singlerepository distributed configuration using Branch Office Caching Services
Singlerepository distributed configuration using Content Servers

questiontext.text: A customer has a requirement to implement a loan services workflow process that sends arequest to an outside creditreporting agency for a credit score. They then want the credit score tobe returned and incorporated into the process.Which xCPrelated feature satisfies this requirement
What is the parent product for EMCs rendition and transformation capabilities
Which Authentication plugin supports single signon SSO and secure communications betweenDocumentum components, while avoiding the overhead of Secure Sockets Layer
Which Documentum product can be used to parse through large volumes of documents and buildtaxonomies based on keywords and other relevant text
When the D2Client is connected to the Documentum repository, which technology is used tomake the connection with the Content Server
Which service is automatically installed when Content Server is installed in a DocumentumWindows environment
Of which components should multiple instances be created to help avoid a single point of failure inthe Documentum repository

answer.text: Connection Broker and Java Method Server

questiontext.text: The following object types are in a Documentum federationGlobal usersGlobal groupsGlobal permission setsWhere are those object types managed
Which service manages the repository and supports clientserver and webbased applications
Which two components constitute a Documentum repository
Which data is distributed in a distributed singlerepository
To which sessions does the Connection Broker provide information
In which object type does the administrator update the defaultacl attribute
An organization with a Service Oriented Architecture SOA wants to leverage remoteDocumentum content management operations.What is required on the application server to satisfy this requirement
Which framework should be used in a Documentum 7 environment
Which statement is correct about adding an attribute to an object type

answer.text: The attribute name must be unique among all attributes of a type, including inherited attributes.
An attribute can be added to Documentum base types.
The added attribute can be in upper or lower case.
The attribute must begin with dm.

questiontext.text: What is a sub type of dmsysobject
For which clients does Documentums Data Dictionary store information
What is shared by a lightweight sysobject LWSO and its parent
Which attribute joins the unmaterialized lightweight sysobjects LWSO to the parent object
Which statement is true regarding the data model for a lightweight sysobject LWSO

answer.text: The data model takes up more space in the underlying database tables than a standard subtype.
The data model takes up the same space in the underlying database tables as a standard subtype.
The data model takes up no space in the underlying database tables.
The data model takes up less space in the underlying database tables than a standard subtype.

questiontext.text: What should be used to push an attribute to all instances of the type dmsysobject
What is a valid name for an attribute on a custom type
What are custom object types

answer.text: Specialized object types that fulfill business requirements
Specialized object types that are created by code
Specialized object types that fulfill architectural requirements
Specialized object types that are created by System Administrators

questiontext.text: Which statement is true regarding the robjectid attribute of a subtype of dmfolder
What is the main purpose of an object type

answer.text: To define a set of metadata attributes and rules pertaining to those attributes
To define a file format and the application that should be used to open that file format
To define an organizational structure for storing documents
To define security rules for access to documents

questiontext.text: What is a valid data type for a custom attribute associated with a custom type
Which attribute is automatically set by the Content Server when a document is created in aDocumentum repository
What happens to all custom attribute values when an objects type is changed to its parent type

answer.text: All custom attribute values are saved.
All custom attribute values are lost.
All custom attribute values are written to a text file.
All custom attribute values are lost 24 hours after the change.

questiontext.text: Refer to the exhibit.In the version tree shown, with Delete permission on the document object, which statement istrue

answer.text: Version 3.6 will remain the current version.
Version 3.4.1.1 cannot be versioned to become a major version.
Version 3.4.1.0 was the current version before version 3.4.1.1 was created.
Version 3.4.1.0 cannot have a checkout operation.
